overview: STATELESS is the story of two dissident journalists, Dogan Özgüden and İnci Tugsavul Özgüden who are forced to leave Turkey after the 12th March 1971 military coup and whose citizenship was revoked in 1982. The documentary tells how Dogan Özgüden and İnci Tugsavul Özgüden, who have been living in exile in Brussels since 1974, keep their vision of a world free of discriminatory ideologies at the multicultural education center Atelier du Soleil (The Sun Workshops) of which they are founders.
title: Vatansız
